subject: problem running junit within ant
msgSnippet: I just downloaded the latest versions of junit and ant, and have copied the junit-4.1.jar into $ANT_HOME/lib. When I run ant, my trivial file compiles fine and
messageBody:
I just downloaded the latest versions of junit and
ant, and have copied the junit-4.1.jar into $ANT_HOME/lib.
When I run ant, my trivial file compiles fine and junit is
reported to run, but it always says the test FAILed, although
I don't even have any assertions in the code. If I add a
main method to the test which calls TestRunner.run, things
seem to work better.

Thanks in advance for helping out the noob.


Here's my ant output:

----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< -----

Buildfile: build.xml

run-tests:
[javac] Compiling 1 source file
[junit] Test TestHello FAILED

BUILD SUCCESSFUL

----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< -----

and my minimal test class:

----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< -----

import junit.framework.TestCase;

public class TestHello extends TestCase
{
public void testHello()
{
assertNull(null);
}
}

----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< -----

and my minimal build.xml file.

----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< -----

<project name="dummy" default="run-tests">
<target name="run-tests">
<javac srcDir="."/>
<junit> <test name="TestHello"/> </junit>
</target>
</project>
